channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What's on the table for the 5 African Presidents meeting Trump at the White House?
item.description: President Trump is hosting 5 African leaders in Washington this week — a mini summit that's raising eyebrows over who was invited, what's on the table...

item.title: Linda Yaccarino steps down after a turbulent two years leading X
item.description: Yaccarino, a traditional business executive, was in many ways a strong foil to the mercurial and controversy-courting Musk. She did not cite a reason ...

item.title: After Iran's war with Israel, questions return about Khamenei's potential successors
item.description: After the 12-day war in June, the issue of who will succeed Iran's longtime supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, has become more urgent.

item.title: Composer and pianist Jason Moran is latest departure from Kennedy Center
item.description: Another departure from the Kennedy Center: Composer, pianist, educator and bandleader Jason Moran announced on social media that he is no longer the a...

item.title: U.S. measles cases hit highest level in 33 years, CDC reports
item.description: The U.S. has hit an unwelcome milestone in measles cases this year. The CDC is reporting 1,288 cases across the country. The disease was declared elim...

item.title: China rejects German claim it targeted military plane with laser
item.description: Germany says a laser fired by a Chinese warship tried to disrupt a reconnaissance plane over the Red Sea.

item.title: Justice Department sues California over transgender athletes
item.description: The Justice Department has filed a lawsuit against the state of California for allegedly violating Title IX by implementing policies that "force girls...

item.title: Ukraine suffers heaviest attack as Trump criticises Putin
item.description: The US president reverses a suspension of weapons shipments to Kyiv and heavily criticises Russia's Putin.

item.title: 7/3: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Trump expected to sign budget bill tomorrow; History behind Independence Day and the events of July 4, 1776

item.title: Video shows New Mexico house being swept away amid deadly flooding
item.description: Dozens of swift-water rescues were carried out after flash flooding hit Ruidoso, New Mexico.

item.title: Republicans urge US universities to cut ties with ‘nefarious’ Chinese-backed scholarship program
item.description: House Republicans are urging seven U.S. universities to cut ties with a Chinese scholarship program that lawmakers call a “nefarious mechanism” to ste...

item.title: 7/2: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: House Republican leaders work to win over holdouts on budget bill; John Bolton, President Trump’s former national security adviser, discusses the Iran...

item.title: How Americans think the government should respond to natural disasters, according to recent polls
Red Bull sack team principal Horner after 20 years
item.description: Christian Horner is sacked as Red Bull team principal after 20 years in the role.

item.title: 7/9: CBS Morning News
item.description: Texas death toll climbs as rescue teams continue search for more than 160 missing people; Santa Fe, New Mexico, named top U.S. travel destination.

item.title: Harrowing stories of rescue emerge from Texas floods as crews search for over 160 reported missing
US cuts visa validity for most Nigerian applicants
item.description: The United States announces sweeping changes to its non-immigrant visa policy for Nigeria.

item.title: Steve Rosenberg: Moscow shrugs off Trump's irritation with Putin
item.description: But the US president's words have not gone unnoticed, writes the BBC's Russia Editor.
